title: PixelNova Studio marketing site (dark + electric blue) with Internet Identity, Stripe UI, free trial, portfolio, funnel, FAQ bot, and dashboard

requirements.summary: Establish a responsive premium dark theme with electric-blue accents, consistent typography (Poppins + Open Sans), spacing, and smooth reveal motion across all core pages.
acceptanceCriteria: All core pages (Home, Services, Pricing, Portfolio, Legal, Funnel, Dashboard) share a consistent visual system (colors, typography, components).
Design is fully responsive (mobile/tablet/desktop) and uses smooth, non-distracting animations (e.g., fade/slide on section reveal).

file_operations.description: Create global styling entry point implementing the dark + electric-blue theme tokens, typography (Poppins + Open Sans), baseline spacing rules, and shared utilities for consistent layout/motion across pages.
Update document head to load Poppins and Open Sans (e.g., via font links) and ensure the base title/metadata aligns with PixelNova Studio branding.
Create a reusable section reveal component (fade/slide-in on view) used across pages for non-distracting motion consistency.
Create shared presentational primitives (e.g., Button/Card/Section wrappers) reflecting the premium dark + electric-blue design system. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create the root app shell applying the global theme (dark mode class), consistent layout wrapper, and shared motion patterns across routes.

requirements.summary: Integrate Internet Identity-only authentication; gate account-required actions; redirect to Dashboard after login; show identity details from profile and II principal; support logout to public Home.
acceptanceCriteria: Unauthenticated users can browse marketing pages but are prompted to sign in when attempting actions that require an account (claim trial, submit order/lead).
After login, the user lands on a Dashboard page that shows their logged-in status and identifier details available via Internet Identity.
Logout returns the user to a public page (e.g., Home).

file_operations.description: Implement Sign in/Sign out controls using the existing Internet Identity hook; clear cached data on logout (React Query clear). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add an auth gate wrapper that renders children for authenticated users and otherwise prompts sign-in (with a return-to action). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add React Query hooks to fetch/save caller user profile using backend methods (getCallerUserProfile/saveCallerUserProfile) while preventing modal flash per authorization component guidance. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Prompt first-time logged-in users to enter name/email/phone to populate backend UserProfile for display in Dashboard and header. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create the post-login landing Dashboard page showing logged-in status and user identity details (profile name/email/phone; principal as secondary info if needed). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create TanStack Router configuration including protected Dashboard route behavior (redirect after successful login when appropriate) and public routes for marketing pages.
Wire the new App/router setup so authentication state is available and routing works; ensure logout navigates back to a public route.

requirements.summary: Build the Home page with the specified hero copy/CTAs, highlights, previews (services/pricing/reviews), and final CTA section.
acceptanceCriteria: Home page includes the specified hero text and the two CTAs.
Home page includes the four “Why Choose Us” items.
Home page includes a reviews section showing multiple review cards (seeded static content is acceptable).

file_operations.description: Implement the Home page sections (hero with exact headline/subheadline and CTAs; Why Choose Us with the four items; services preview; pricing preview; reviews preview; final CTA) using shared theme components and AnimatedSection. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Register the Home route and ensure CTAs navigate to the required destinations (Start My Project -> funnel/order entry; View Portfolio -> portfolio page).

requirements.summary: Create the Services page with four animated service cards including description, price (where specified), delivery time, and an Order action starting the order flow for the selected service/package.
acceptanceCriteria: Services page lists all four services and shows the specified prices for non-website services.
Clicking an Order button navigates to an order form/checkout step for that selected service/package.

file_operations.description: Create Services page listing Website Design, Logo Design ($10), Presentation Design ($5), Business Card Design ($10) as animated cards with description, price, delivery time, and Order button. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create an order entry page that can accept a preselected service/package from Services page navigation state/query params. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Register Services and Order routes and ensure Service card Order buttons route into Order with selected offering context.

requirements.summary: Create a Pricing page presenting Standard and highlighted Premium website packages with listed features and Stripe checkout action; show a clear not-configured state when Stripe is unavailable.
acceptanceCriteria: Pricing page displays both packages with the listed feature bullets and visually highlights Premium as recommended/best value.
A Stripe checkout flow is available from the Pricing page (or a clear path to it) for paid offerings.
If Stripe is not configured at runtime, the UI displays a clear configuration/error state instead of failing silently.

file_operations.description: Implement Pricing page with Standard ($199) and highlighted Premium ($300) packages, feature bullets exactly as specified, and checkout actions. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add hooks to check Stripe configuration (isStripeConfigured) and create a checkout session (createCheckoutSession) with robust JSON parsing and missing-url error handling, following the Stripe component guidance. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create payment success route/page for Stripe redirects; confirm payment completion status using getStripeSessionStatus and show an English confirmation message. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create payment failure/cancel route/page for Stripe redirects; show an English failure/cancel message and a way back to Pricing. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Register Pricing, /payment-success, and /payment-failure routes and wire checkout actions to use window.location.href for Stripe URLs.

requirements.summary: Implement authenticated one-time free website trial claim UI: prompt sign-in if needed, call server-side claim, show already-claimed state, and display upgrade prompt after claim.
acceptanceCriteria: Unauthenticated users attempting to claim are prompted to sign in.
Authenticated users can claim the free trial exactly once; subsequent attempts show an “already claimed” state.
After a successful claim, the UI shows an upgrade prompt/modal with the specified message (English).

file_operations.description: Create a free trial claim UI component that is gated by RequireAuth; calls backend claimFreeTrial; handles already-claimed state; triggers upgrade modal after success. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Implement the post-claim modal/popup with the exact message: “Upgrade to Premium to Unlock Full Website & Remove Watermark”. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Place the FreeTrialClaimCard on Pricing (or another relevant page) to make the flow discoverable; ensure unauthenticated users are prompted to sign in. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Show free-trial claimed/available status on Dashboard and provide an upgrade CTA to Premium. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Create a Portfolio page with client-side filters, grid items including specified example names, hover interaction with “Get Similar Design”, and CTA into order flow.
acceptanceCriteria: Portfolio filters update the visible items on the page without a reload.
Each portfolio card has a hover state including a visible “Get Similar Design” action.
The page includes an “Order My Design Now” CTA that routes into the order flow.

file_operations.description: Implement Portfolio page with filters (All | Websites | Logos | Presentations | Business Cards), grid containing the specified example names, hover zoom + “Get Similar Design” action, and an “Order My Design Now” CTA. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Register Portfolio route and wire CTA actions to navigate into the order flow.

requirements.summary: Add Legal pages (Terms & Conditions, Refund Policy, Privacy Policy) and ensure the Refund Policy includes the exact statement about refunds.
acceptanceCriteria: All three legal pages exist and are reachable from the site navigation/footer.
Refund Policy includes the exact statement “No refunds once design work has started.”

file_operations.description: Create Terms & Conditions page with English-only content consistent with site theme. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create Refund Policy page and include the exact statement: “No refunds once design work has started.” Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create Privacy Policy page with English-only content consistent with site theme. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Register Legal routes for Terms, Refund Policy, and Privacy Policy.
Add footer with links to all three legal pages and core navigation. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add header navigation linking to Home/Services/Pricing/Portfolio and authentication controls. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Implement an authenticated order/request flow: capture selected package/service, project notes, optional file uploads, and manual payment screenshot validation when manual payment is chosen; submit to backend; display in Dashboard.
acceptanceCriteria: Order form captures at minimum: selected service/package, project notes, and optional file upload(s).
Submitting an order creates a stored record tied to the authenticated user and appears in the Dashboard list.
If manual payment screenshot is required for a chosen manual-payment option, the form validates that an image was uploaded before submission.

file_operations.description: Implement the order form UI: selected service/package, notes, payment method choice (Stripe vs Manual), optional attachments, and validation requiring a screenshot image when Manual is selected. Use RequireAuth to block access unless logged in. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add a React Query mutation hook that calls submitOrder and handles success/errors; include logic to associate uploaded screenshot/attachments via blob-storage file reference where applicable. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Implement helper hook to convert File -> bytes and upload using ExternalBlob (blob-storage) via saveFileReference, with optional progress handling. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Render the authenticated user's orders list with at least package/service + date + status; ensure empty states and error states are handled gracefully. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Display manual payment number “9911553387” and the message “Work will begin only after payment confirmation.” as informational text on relevant pages without implementing UPI processing.
acceptanceCriteria: The number “9911553387” appears exactly and is copyable as text.
The page includes the message “Work will begin only after payment confirmation.” (English).
No UI suggests that the site can process UPI payments directly (only informational display).

file_operations.description: Create a reusable informational block displaying “9911553387” and “Work will begin only after payment confirmation.” with clear labeling that it is manual payment info only. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Include ManualPaymentInfo in Pricing near alternative/manual payment guidance (informational only). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Show ManualPaymentInfo when the user selects Manual payment; ensure no UPI processing UI is implied. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add a bottom-right deterministic scripted chatbot/FAQ widget (no AI) that qualifies users, suggests packages based on budget rules, upsells free trial, reminds about payment, captures lead info, and stores leads to backend; show leads in Dashboard.
acceptanceCriteria: Chat widget is fixed in the bottom-right and can be opened/closed.
Bot follows a deterministic script (no external AI/LLM calls).
Budget rule is implemented: < $200 suggests Standard; ≥ $300 recommends Premium; values in-between produce a reasonable neutral suggestion.
Lead capture form stores submissions in the backend and is viewable in a simple leads list (e.g., in Dashboard).

file_operations.description: Implement the bottom-right toggleable chatbot widget (“Nova AI Assistant” label as provided), deterministic scripted flow (greeting → qualification → package suggestion → free trial upsell → payment reminder → lead capture). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Define the fixed script, state machine, and budget suggestion rules (< $200 Standard; ≥ $300 Premium; in-between neutral) with English-only copy. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add React Query mutation to submit chatbot lead details (submitChatbotLead) including optional chat history; handle success/validation errors gracefully. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Mount ChatbotWidget globally so it appears on all pages as a fixed bottom-right widget. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add a simple section listing the user's submitted chatbot leads (if available via dashboard data) with empty states. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Implement a basic funnel flow: Landing CTA → lead capture form → thank-you page; store the lead; show confirmation message (no email).
acceptanceCriteria: There is a dedicated lead capture page/form that can be reached from a CTA.
On successful submission, the user is navigated to a thank-you page that confirms receipt (English).
Lead submissions are stored in the backend.

file_operations.description: Create a funnel landing page/section with a strong CTA leading to the lead capture form (“Get Free Website Demo” as specified). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create lead capture form collecting Name/Email/Phone and submitting via submitFormLead; include client-side validation and loading/error states. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create thank-you/confirmation page shown after successful lead submission with an English confirmation message. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add React Query mutation for submitFormLead and navigation to ThankYou on success. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Register funnel routes (landing, lead form, thank-you) and wire key CTAs (Home hero/final CTA and other relevant CTAs) to the funnel entry.

requirements.summary: Build a post-login Dashboard showing free-trial status, user orders list with timestamps/status, and a list of the user’s submitted leads (if any), with graceful empty states.
acceptanceCriteria: Dashboard shows an explicit “Free Trial: Claimed/Available” indicator.
Dashboard lists orders (at least package/service + date + status).
Dashboard page loads data from the backend and handles empty states gracefully (e.g., “No orders yet”).

file_operations.description: Add React Query hook to fetch dashboard data via getDashboard and normalize empty states/loading/error UI needs. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Render dashboard sections: free-trial indicator; orders list (package/service + date + status); leads lists (form leads and/or general leads as available), with clear empty states and consistent styling. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Ensure Dashboard route is registered and protected by RequireAuth so it is only accessible after Internet Identity login.

requirements.summary: Add responsive site header/footer navigation to all core pages and legal pages; include auth controls; implement basic per-page SEO metadata (titles/descriptions) and ensure public pages remain accessible without login while gating authenticated-only actions.
acceptanceCriteria: Navigation provides working links to all core pages and legal pages.
Page titles are set appropriately per route (e.g., “Pricing | PixelNova Studio”).
Public pages are accessible without login; authenticated-only actions are gated.

file_operations.description: Create a shared layout wrapping routed pages with SiteHeader and SiteFooter, consistent spacing, and container widths. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Include nav links to Home/Services/Pricing/Portfolio and a Legal link group (or footer-only legal links) plus Internet Identity auth controls. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Ensure footer includes links to Terms, Refund Policy, and Privacy Policy. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add a small hook/helper to set document title and meta description per route/page in English (e.g., “Pricing | PixelNova Studio”). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Use the page meta hook to set appropriate title/description for Home. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Use the page meta hook to set appropriate title/description for Services. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Use the page meta hook to set appropriate title/description for Pricing. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Use the page meta hook to set appropriate title/description for Portfolio. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Use the page meta hook to set appropriate title/description for Dashboard and keep it auth-protected. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Wrap routed content with SiteLayout and ensure auth-gated actions (claim trial, order submission) use RequireAuth prompts rather than blocking general browsing. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Define and apply a distinctive, coherent component styling direction (dark + electric-blue) for buttons, cards, sections, and glow/gradients, consistently across the site without adding new features.
acceptanceCriteria: A single, consistent theme is applied throughout the site (colors, button variants, card styles, section backgrounds).
Theme remains dark with electric-blue accents and avoids adding unrelated features/content.

file_operations.description: Refine and document theme styling rules (colors, gradients/glows, button variants, card styling, section backgrounds) and ensure consistent application site-wide.
Extend Tailwind theme (as needed) to support electric-blue accent utilities, glow shadows, and consistent radii/spacing aligned with the premium dark theme.
Ensure shared components implement the finalized styling rules and are consistently used across pages. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add generated asset: PixelNova Studio wordmark logo, modern geometric style, electric-blue glow on dark background (frontend/public/assets/generated/pixelnova-logo.dim_512x512.png).
Add generated asset: Abstract dark gradient hero background with subtle electric-blue neon glow and soft noise texture (frontend/public/assets/generated/hero-bg.dim_1920x1080.png).
Add generated asset: Set of four simple line icons with neon-blue glow: website, logo, presentation, business card (frontend/public/assets/generated/service-icons-sprite.dim_1024x256.png).

Wire hero background and brand logo into the Home page using the generated assets at frontend/public/assets/generated/hero-bg.dim_1920x1080.png and frontend/public/assets/generated/pixelnova-logo.dim_512x512.png. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Use the generated service icon sprite frontend/public/assets/generated/service-icons-sprite.dim_1024x256.png for service cards to reinforce consistent visual language. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
